title: There’s now a baby spa and it might be over the top (9 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
I’m not really sure what I was getting into when I was a baby, but if my mom ever sent me to a spa to get a massage I definitely don’t remember it. Chances are she didn’t since they weren’t around, but now they are. 2 
Baby Spa Perth is a baby spa franchise that has locations in South Africa and Australia. They specialize in hydrotherapy and massages for around $65. 3 
While putting a baby’s body on a floating pod so that only their head is above water looks a little unorthodox and strange–but cute–this style of hydrotherapy is supposed to have health benefits for the young tykes. 4 
The benefits “range from improved sleep quality, reduced discomfort from colic, wind, constipation and reflux while regular visits can benefit the cardiovascular and respiratory systems.” 5 
Muscle growth also seems to be a benefit of the massage methods as they stretch the baby’s limbs in what looks like a great time for the infants. Advertisement Advertisement 6 
The spa takes babies as young as 2 days old all the way up to 6 months old. 7 
It looks like a ton of fun being submerged in water with other little buddies your age and then being pampered with massages and aromatic lotions. 8 
This massage looks like it could be a lifesaver after a long week of napping, baby formula, and playing with toys. 
Aren’t they all just adorable?
